description: A normal looking high school girl on the outside, Kusakabe Maron is actually the reincarnation of Jeanne d' Arc. With the help of the angel, Fin Fish, Maron works as the thief Jeanne at night to seal the demons that reside in pieces of artwork, preying upon the weak hearts of the owners. She is branded as a thief due to the fact that the artworks disappear after she seals the demons. One day, a new neighbor and classmate appears, as well as a rival in her night job, the thief Sinbad. With her own best friend being the detective's daughter, out to capture her and the appearance of her new rival, Maron's work is anything but easy.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Acrobatics
tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

node.description:
**Doujin Circle:** Meguro Teikoku (目黒帝国, with [Meguro](https://anilist.co/staff/150816/Meguro)), Strawberry Lunch (with [Ai Minase](https://anilist.co/staff/100342/Ai-Minase))

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/arinacchi) | [Website](http://tanemuraarina.com/)

Arina Tanemura likes Japanese pop music very much (especially [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto), Aya Matsuura and the all-girl, [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/Morning-Musume)) and she loves the game series Final Fantasy. She has one elder and one younger sister and one brother. She hates to lose (in every point of view) and she loves the Margaret Magazine of Shueisha. She says that she is too fat and that she dislikes her face. She has two cats named Riku and Kai, and at Tanemura's homepage you can find many photos of them. She wants to draw like no-one else (she can't lose...) and she loves to go to karaoke with her assistants (friends). She is good friends with the manga-ka [Ryo Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98904/Ryo-Maekawa) and [Ruka Kazuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100291/Ruka-Kazuki).

She's not really a fan of yaoi (boys' love) manga, but she has made a yaoi doujinshi (no specified title) for one of her friends. She has also made a few adults-only comics on Full Moon wo Sagashite and Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne.

Her nicknames include the sobriquets "Arinacchi" and "Arinaccho" (Arinaccho is a humorous play on Arinacchi, and was said just because of the ridiculousness of it all).

Arina participated in Shinshi Doumei Cross drama CDs as [Yoshitaka Ichinomiya](https://anilist.co/character/3507/Yoshitaka-Ichinomiya) and Postman.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋晃_(アニメーター%29)

Affiliated with [Bandai Namco Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6116/). Noted for his work in the Precure franchise.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/147908/)._

[Official Website]() | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shazna) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHAZNA)

__SHAZNA__ was a visual-kei band. They reunited again in 2017 for their 20th anniversary.

She wants to draw like no-one else (she can't lose...) and she loves to go to karaoke with her assistants (friends). She's not really a fan of yaoi (boys' love) manga, but she has made a yaoi doujinshi (no specified title) for one of her friends. She has also made a few adults-only comics on Full Moon wo Sagashite and Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne.

Her nicknames include the sobriquets "Arinacchi" and "Arinaccho" (Arinaccho is a humorous play on Arinacchi, and was said just because of the ridiculousness of it all).

__Height:__ 158 cm

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kuwashima-houko.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/roudokuya_dajai) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houko_Kuwashima) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/桑島法子)

Houko Kuwashima is a Japanese voice actress and singer. She is capable of playing a variety of roles, ranging from young boys to feminine women. Kuwashima is currently affiliated with Aoni Production. Her first major role was as Yurika Misumaru in Martian Successor Nadesico.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Android 21 - Dragon Ball FighterZ (VG)
- Presea Combatir - Tales of Symphonia (VG)
- Serenica - Dragon Quest XI S: Echoes of an Elusive Age - Definitive Edition (VG)
- Kasumi - Dead or Alive series (VG)
- Roselinde Freya - Shining Blade (VG)
- Mei Ling - Metal Gear Series (VG)
- Jingliu - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Ries Argent - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
